page.title: 14Ecology
page.content: This is an area of natural beauty and because of this there has been very little change or building over the last thirty years. The woodland is both coniferous and deciduous and there are tracts of bracken where small sections of trees have been cleared. The River Monnow flows gently between rolling hills and farmlands. The whole area appears slow-moving and peaceful. The Community Council intends taking part in a survey of the local flora and fauna.The farmers have been under some criticism for heavy spraying in the past,though this has now been reduced.The survey will detail any effects of the spraying.
